page.title: 06SALTBURN COMMUNITY SERVICES
page.content: Saltburn is well equipped for its community and voluntary services. Some relate to its position as a seaside resort such as Lifeguards, Red Cross and Coastguards. There are 3 doctors practices, 2 of which cover Marske as well as Saltburn and also a clinic to provide maternity care. The present police station replaced the old one in 1928, but has decreased in importance (with major crimes being referred to Redcar). The fire brigade is run by volunteers and those who turn up at an emergency are paid. Voluntary services provide help for nearly all needs. Suprisingly not many unemployed youths volunteer for this work but many middle aged women do. There are various associations, play groups, social groups and groups catering for the handicapped.(F.Roughton,J.Croker)
